comments:
The Ecore binding of the OCL metamodel extends the Ecore metamodel, so it
inherits the hierarchical-name-based fragment URIs of Ecore's
ENamedElements (viz. the EModelElementImpl methods eURIFragmentSegment and
eObjectForURIFragmentSegment).It looks like something is going wrong with the resolution of these URI fragments.

Context of error:
After some registrations (because I work standalone) I have loaded the UmlTest.uml Model and have produced a serialized XMI file containing the parsed constraints. After opening these XMI File I get the following error:
Example:
Model:
<source xsi:type="ocl.uml:VariableExp" name="self" referredVariable="/1/@specification/self">

I compared the created OCL ECORE XMI File with the OCL UML XMI file (I persist constraints, and loaded TestOCL.uml, TestOcl.ecore). This are the differences:
UML:
<source xsi:type="ocl.uml:VariableExp" name="self" referredVariable="/1/@specification/self">

ECORE:
<source xsi:type="ocl.ecore:VariableExp" name="self" referredVariable="/0/@specification/@contextVariable">

UML takes the name (self) after specification
ECORE: @specification/@contextVariable

My Manuell Changes in UML:
<source xsi:type="ocl.uml:VariableExp" name="self" referredVariable="/1/@specification/@contextVariable">

Maybe this will help in order to fix this bug. 
Is it possible to fix this bug for release 1.1?

Thanks for the additional diagnostic information.

The 1.1 release is complete as of today.  Because this bug is marked with "enhancement" severity, it is targeted (but not planned for) the 1.2 release.  If it is a serious problem, it probably shouldn't be an enhancement.  If it is sufficiently severe, then it might be considered for the 1.1.1 maintenance release.  However, there is a simple work-around, which is just to use UUIDs in your resources, so it may have difficulty qualifying for the maintenance release.
